title: What is the difference between Coulombic and electrostatic force? - Quora

response.answer_text: Coulomb is unit of the charge and given by q=ampere * second or(A*s) and electrostatic force F between the two charges is directly proportional to product of two charges and inversely proportional to square of distance (r) between them. F proportional q’*q”/r^2 unit=coulomb^2 /meter^2 =newton
Both being the same has no difference, but a way of different representation.
